issues.title: SG startup draining contract at ~200F is not wired into runtime execution path
observations: Technical documentation specifies SG draining at approximately 200F, but runtime scanning found only the StartDraining declaration and no invocation path.
Expected startup mass-state transition for SG secondary inventory appears unexecuted, risking mismatch between documented and simulated SG initial conditions.

links: Assigned DP: DP-0011 - Steam Generator Secondary Physics (Audit Reopen)

issues.title: SG secondary pressure response does not begin at RCP circulation onset; rise is delayed until near-boiling
observations: Technical documentation defines SG warmup as simultaneous heating and pressurization: as RCP heat input warms SG secondary, pressure should rise with temperature and later be regulated by steam dump control.

Current build logs show SG secondary pressure remains near blanket floor (~17 psia) from first non-zero RCP circulation through extended post-bubble RCP-driven warmup and temperature rise, then increases only near/after boiling onset, indicating delayed pressure response inconsistent with documented warmup behavior.

Scope note: this CS starts at first non-zero RCP circulation (ramp onset) after bubble precondition and does not require full pump ramp completion. Bubble formation/draining timing defects are tracked separately under existing bubble-phase CS items and are not duplicated here.

In latest build run, with RCPs at 4/4 and SG top node increasing from 109.53F to 216.90F (13.25hr -> 16.00hr), SG pressure remains only 17.1 -> 17.8 psia; pressure rise accelerates only near 234.95F/255.31F around boiling transition.

Acceptance criteria: SG secondary pressure response must begin at circulation onset (first non-zero RCP state) and continue directionally upward through warmup, even if initial increments are small, without remaining floor-clamped until near-boiling transition.
Disposition update: currently BLOCKED pending condenser/permissive boundary modeling tracked under CS-0115.

hypotheses: Startup pressure source selection and/or floor-clamped boundary behavior in OPEN_PREHEAT and early ISOLATED_HEATUP is suppressing expected compressibility/thermal-expansion pressure rise.
Pressure evolution may be over-coupled to boiling activation thresholds, producing near-flat pre-boil pressure instead of gradual warmup pressurization.
issues.resolution_candidate: BLOCKED pending CS-0115. Resume pre-boil pressurization remediation after condenser/permissive boundary contract is implemented and validated.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0011 - Steam Generator Secondary Physics (Audit Reopen)
Related closed chain: CS-0017, CS-0019, CS-0020, CS-0054 (reopened symptom class under current build evidence).
Prerequisite dependency (separate scope): bubble formation/draining issue chain CS-0072, CS-0074, CS-0075, CS-0076.
Blocked by: CS-0115 (missing condenser + feedwater return module and steam-dump permissive boundary contract).

issues.title: SG startup boundary behavior is modeled isolated where references indicate steam-line warmup/open-path behavior.
observations: Derived from Conformance Audit finding F-004.
SG startup boundary behavior is modeled isolated where references indicate steam-line warmup/open-path behavior.
Requirement expectation: SG startup references describe MSIV-open steam-line warming during heatup.
Current implementation mismatch: ShouldIsolateSGBoundary enforces isolation outside OpenPreheat/SteamDump and SG thermal path zeros steam outflow when isolated.
Recommended action from audit: Instrument.

evidence.notes: F-004 reference expectation: SG startup references describe MSIV-open steam-line warming during heatup.
F-004 implementation evidence: ShouldIsolateSGBoundary enforces isolation outside OpenPreheat/SteamDump and SG thermal path zeros steam outflow when isolated.

links: Finding source: F-004 in Technical_Documentation/Conformance_Audit_Report_2026-02-15.md
NCR source retired after migration: Governance/NCR/NCR_2026-02-15_F-004.md

issues.title: PZR temperature monitoring missing for bubble formation readiness during cold startup
observations: ValidationDashboard displays T_pzr as numeric readout but provides no comparison to T_sat.
No annunciator exists for PZR approaching or reaching saturation temperature.
NRC HRTD 17.0 specifies bubble formation occurs when T_pzr reaches T_sat (450°F at 400 psig).
Operators cannot visually determine when pressurizer is ready for bubble draw.

evidence.notes: Full investigation report with root cause analysis and fix options.
Heat PZR to T_sat (450°F at 400 psig) as key sequencing step.
When pressurizer temperature reaches saturation temperature... a pressurizer bubble is established.
T_pzr captured but no PZR subcooling calculated.
No annunciator tile for PZR saturation approach.

hypotheses: Dashboard was designed with post-bubble operations as primary focus; pre-bubble cold startup monitoring was not implemented.
issues.root_cause: Missing pre-bubble monitoring instrumentation for T_pzr approach to T_sat.
issues.resolution_candidate: Add PZR subcooling readout (T_sat - T_pzr) and PZR SAT annunciator tile (INFO severity, triggers when subcooling <= 5°F).
links: Assigned DP: DP-0008 - Operator Interface & Scenarios
Likely impacted: Assets/Scripts/Validation/ValidationDashboard.Snapshot.cs
Likely impacted: Assets/Scripts/Validation/ValidationDashboard.Annunciators.cs
Likely impacted: Assets/Scripts/Validation/Tabs/OverviewTab.cs

issues.title: PZR Mode 5 pre-heater pressurization: validate net +1 gpm charging imbalance vs documented expectations
observations: Mode 5 solid startup pre-heater pressurization shows approximately +1 gpm charging/letdown net, not the larger imbalance documented in startup references.
Observed pressure ramp is around 176-184 psi/hr in early pre-heater window, above documented 50-100 psi/hr guidance.
Heater power is already active during early solid pre-heater period, so ramp is not purely CVCS-imbalance driven.

evidence.notes: Full diagnostic-to-resolution investigation and corrective scope.
Sequence: charging>letdown pressurization to 400-425 psig, then heater energization.
Documented net +20-40 gpm and approximately 50-100 psi/hr expectation.
Pressure rate 176.48 psi/hr, net CVCS +1.0 gpm, heater power already non-zero.
HEATER_PRESSURIZE trim clamped to +/-1 gpm around balanced 75/75 base flows.

hypotheses: Startup pre-heater behavior is currently governed by a capped controller trim envelope that cannot realize the documented larger CVCS imbalance window.
issues.root_cause: Solid-plant HEATER_PRESSURIZE logic limits CVCS net trim to +/-1 gpm while early heater participation contributes to pressure rise, yielding a mechanism/rate mismatch versus documented startup expectations.
issues.resolution_candidate: Define explicit Mode 5 pre-heater policy boundary: parameterized CVCS imbalance/rate envelope aligned to documentation, heater-sequencing handoff at documented transition, and clear controller ownership separation.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0012 - Pressurizer & Startup Control
No implementation under CS; create an IP before code changes.

issues.title: PZR temperature (T_pzr) lacks primary visualization — no arc gauge or trend display
observations: Pressurizer column has arc gauges for PRESSURE and LEVEL, but not T_pzr.
T_pzr readout is misplaced in RCS column instead of Pressurizer column.
No T_pzr sparkline trend exists - cannot observe heating trajectory over time.
Operators cannot visualize PZR heating trajectory toward saturation during cold startup.
Per NRC HRTD 17.0, T_pzr reaching T_sat is the key milestone for bubble formation.

evidence.notes: Full investigation report with root cause and fix options.
PZR column has PRESSURE and LEVEL arc gauges, no T_pzr gauge.
T_pzr displayed in RCS column, not PZR column.

hypotheses: Dashboard was designed with post-bubble operations as primary focus; pre-bubble PZR heating visualization was deprioritized.
issues.root_cause: Missing primary T_pzr visualization (arc gauge) in Pressurizer column.
issues.resolution_candidate: Add T_pzr arc gauge to Pressurizer column, relocate T_pzr readout from RCS to PZR column, add T_pzr sparkline trend (replace NET HEAT).
links: Assigned DP: DP-0008 - Operator Interface & Scenarios
Related: CS-0108 (closed) - PZR subcooling added but T_pzr visualization gap remains

issues.title: Missing condenser + feedwater return module and startup permissive boundary contract (C-9/P-12) for steam-dump integration
observations: Technical documentation now defines startup boundary behavior with explicit MSIV-bypass warming states, condenser-availability (C-9) gating, and P-12 low-low Tavg blocking/bypass rules.
Runtime steam-dump auto-enable logic currently checks only T_avg and SG steam pressure, with no C-9 or P-12 inputs wired into controller authority.
Forensics logs show repeated Boiling <-> Subcooled toggling near ~220F while SG secondary pressure remains near 17.0-17.1 psia, indicating missing startup sink/permissive boundary integration.
Current startup logs and telemetry do not expose condenser vacuum/CW/hotwell/C-9/P-12 states, preventing validation against documented startup permissives.
Condenser and feedwater indicators in runtime UI remain placeholder-only, consistent with a missing condenser/feedwater return-path simulation contract.

evidence.notes: Defines C-9 condenser-available interlock as mandatory gate for steam-dump operation.
C-9 actuation/reset requirements are vacuum and CW-pump dependent (vacuum <22 inHg blocks, >=22 inHg with >=1 CW pump enables).
Documents hotwell/condensate/feedwater/AFW return-path inventory linkage required for closed-loop startup behavior.
Steam dump interlocks include C-9 condenser available.
P-12 low-low Tavg logic blocks dump operation below threshold unless bypassed per procedure.
ShouldAutoEnable() checks only T_avg and steam pressure.
Startup steam-dump auto-enable path calls ShouldAutoEnable() without condenser/permissive gating.
Initial SG pressure source is floor with OPEN boundary startup mode.
Forensics schema has SG thermodynamic fields but no condenser vacuum/C-9/P-12 telemetry fields.
At T_rcs~225F and boiling active, SGSecPressure remains ~17.1 psia while steam rate varies strongly, indicating missing boundary sink/permissive coupling.
Authoritative startup spec requires C-9/P-12-gated dump bridge states.
Startup sequence explicitly defines Dumps Unavailable/Armed/Modulating states keyed to C-9/P-12.
Condenser is the secondary sink and condensate source in startup/feedwater train context.
Steam dumps to condenser if C-9 is satisfied, then condenses in hotwell and recirculates in closed loop.
Condenser vacuum value remains placeholder in runtime UI, reflecting missing condenser runtime state model.

hypotheses: Disposition: INCONSISTENT with Technical_Documentation startup boundary requirements and steam-dump permissive logic.
issues.root_cause: The simulator lacks a plant-style secondary boundary contract: no condenser state (vacuum/CW/C-9), no modeled P-12 startup blocking path into dump authority, and no closed-loop hotwell/condensate/feedwater/AFW return-path integration in startup SG mass/energy boundary logic.
issues.resolution_candidate: Disposition INCONSISTENT. Corrective scope: (1) add CondenserState module with vacuum/backpressure/CW and C-9 output, (2) add FeedwaterReturnState with hotwell/condensate/feedwater/AFW inventory/availability coupling, (3) implement startup steam-boundary FSM (vents -> MSIV bypass warmup -> MSIV open -> dump bridge), (4) gate steam-dump authority by C-9 and P-12/bypass states, (5) expose condenser/permissive telemetry in heatup logs and validation dashboards, (6) re-run CS-0078 validation after integration. No code changes under CS; execution requires IP scope within IP-0046.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0011 - Steam Generator Secondary Physics (Audit Reopen)
Assigned IP: IP-0046 - SG Startup Boundary and Pressure Response Rescheduled Execution
Blocks: CS-0078 until condenser/permissive boundary behavior is modeled and validated.
Investigation report: Governance/Issues/CS-0115_Investigation_Report_2026-02-17_211000.md
No code changes without a corresponding IP.
